title: Binary Tree Implementation
subject: CS101
description: Implement a binary search tree with insert, delete, and search operations. Include proper documentation and test cases that demonstrate all functionality.
instructions: Submit your code with proper comments and include comprehensive test cases that demonstrate all operations. Your implementation should handle edge cases and include time complexity analysis.

title: Sorting Algorithm Analysis
subject: CS102
description: Compare the performance of different sorting algorithms and provide a detailed analysis report with empirical data.
instructions: Include time complexity analysis, space complexity, performance graphs, and empirical testing results. Compare at least 5 different sorting algorithms.

title: Database Design Project
subject: CS103
description: Design a normalized database schema for an e-commerce system with proper relationships and constraints.
instructions: Include ER diagram, normalized tables up to 3NF, sample data insertion scripts, and query examples. Document your design decisions.
feedback: Excellent work! The database design is well-normalized and includes all necessary constraints. The ER diagram is clear and comprehensive. Minor suggestion: consider adding more indexes for performance optimization.

title: React Web Application
subject: CS104
description: Build a full-stack web application using React, Node.js, and MongoDB. The application should include user authentication and CRUD operations.
instructions: Submit source code, deployment instructions, and a demo video. Include unit tests and API documentation.

rubric.description: React components, UI/UX design, and responsiveness
API design, database integration, and authentication
Clean code, proper structure, and documentation
Unit tests, integration tests, and deployment guide

title: Software Testing Report
subject: CS105
description: Create a comprehensive testing strategy and execute test cases for a given software project.
instructions: Include test plan, test cases, bug reports, and testing metrics. Use both manual and automated testing approaches.

title: Network Security Analysis
subject: CS106
description: Analyze network vulnerabilities and propose security measures for a corporate network infrastructure.
instructions: Include vulnerability assessment, risk analysis, and detailed security recommendations with implementation plans.

title: Machine Learning Model
subject: CS107
description: Develop and train a machine learning model for image classification using deep learning techniques.
instructions: Submit Python code, trained model, dataset analysis, and performance evaluation report.
